intro: Hieracium dunense, commonly known as the Dun Valley hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Its leaves are basal, rough, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium dunense is often found in coastal and inland areas, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
